post.body: I feel your pain, brother. Believe me.
I don't dispute the details of the Ruby post, but I just can't share the perspective. He has apparently only developed in Ruby.
I have a Pandora station tuned for Jack Johnson, John Mayer & Pete Yorn. I suppose that makes me a light weight.
/Jack Johnson/ Great analogy, but what's wrong with Jack? I'm a huge fan.
Thanks for the link. The pictures make the trip look like a rousing success.
Every time I've tried to use SSIS I've ended up opening Visual FoxPro instead. Every time.
Cool, those android phones are sweet!
@averyj Agreed, some Ryan Adams albums are better than others, but there are none that I'm particularly disappointed with.
I liked Easy Tiger and Gold too. Actually, I think Ryan Adams is one of the more consistant songwriters working today.
Dude, my Mom's been on twitter for a while now. Hi @grandnana!
Nothing, but @jamescbender was getting a little too excited about them.
/cartoons/ Dude, put the pipe down.
I think we can take up a collection for the money, if you can arrange the schedule. You are in demand, brother!
Dude, that blows! What will it take to get you there?
I'll come if you cover my T&E. ;-)
You were missed last night. Great seeing you and meeting your wife.
/kewl kids/ Gordon Birsch right after MDC ends until they kick me out.
You can still come out tonight and hang with the Kewl Kids.
I like your boss too. By not playing well, i meant that you don't have to be at work at the same time as others.
I don't have a #SantaHat for #MDCAtlanta, but I will be wearing my Jesus hair.
I think the difference is that you and @rickstrahl are lone wolves. Most of us have to play well with others.
To be clear, you were the 400th person I followed. I'm out of control. ;-)
You weren't supposed to tell people about the sporking!
I gave up on unity mode. I just run my VM full screen in space #2 all the time.
I'm a huge fan of spooning. Just ask most of the twittertribe!
Sporxite: spooning + forking + @rachelappel ;-)
/Toledo/ Looking forward to seeing you at Detroit MDC! Will you be traveling to Toledo from the Detroit event?
I just caught up on your status. Get well, Brother!
@faithfulgeek The theme should not constrain the topics. Topics will already be constrained to issues relating to development.
I'm not have this conversation with you again. Talk to @athought if you want to question my qualifications and understanding.
The difference is that they are multi-day. It seems like it takes at least two days to really build momentum at a mixed conference.
/IM/ Because I'm behind a fascist corporate firewall. I can't even access GMail!
A theme is not necessary for events like RCC, CodeStock or the MDC Community Courtyard, but very appropriate at CodeMash & DevLink.
Creativity is actually stimulated by constraints. The theme actually promotes conversation in my experience.
Thanks. Perhaps I should join the CodeMash Google group. ;-)
Are you really using the term "isolation frameworks"? I never had any problem understanding the purpose of a mocking framework.
Your new avatar kicks ass! :-)
soy++!
Anyone have any experience with Ruby In Steel PE? http://tinyurl.com/4qszkp
Currently enjoying this Dave Thomas talk from RubyConf thanks to @blowmage: http://rubyconf2008.confreaks.com/keynote.html
Has anyone tried Oxite? http://www.codeplex.com/oxite
I almost never close FireFox. Currently, it is using 20% of my CPU and 352mb while doing nothing.
This guy thinks Ruby is too mainstream and stagnant. Absolutely fascinating perspective: http://is.gd/8nYv
This is awesome! http://www.hugoware.net/jLINQ (h/t @glengordon)
Christmas shopping with @micheledossett
I do *NOT* like fighting fires. Stress makes me want to curl up in the fetal position under my desk.
My client has apparently blocked https access to any google domain at the proxy. Brilliant! (not)
Keynote at #MDCAtlanta http://twitpic.com/tbil
I'm heading out for #AtlantaMDC. Must find Starbucks!
Three Oxite blog posts in a row in my reader this morning. Seriously?
I'm beat. I'll finish tweaking my slides for #MDCAtlanta at 5:00 am.
Congratulations to @humancompiler. He is my 400th follow. I <3 Twitter, obviously.
Is anyone from Toledo attending the Detroit MSDN DevCon? If so please contact me.
Here's a summary of the guidlines for selecting a theme for an Open Space event: http://is.gd/e1bg
I can't access the CodeMash Google Group from the office. :-(
Getting stoked about CodeMash Open Spaces. Can anyone recommend a free site to host a poll so we can vote on the theme?
Enjoying another quiet day at the office. @micheledossett has the house to herself all day.
Finished Christmas Story. Now, on to It's a Wonderful Life!
This Christmas proved that if you ask for a guitar in this household you will likely get one. Total number of guitars opened today: 4.
Alone in the living room. Just started A Christmas Story
